s.text: Who and what influenced The Sound ? James Joyce and Ulysses ? Can only a Southerner truly appreciate Faulkner's settings?
William Faulkner's The Sound and the Fury was the subject of the new "Reading" thread this week.
Clinton's critics have turned up the rhetoric, even referring to him as a "rapist"--while Starr's critics are accusing him of being party to a witness-tampering scheme.
Chapter 1, a k a the "Benjy" chapter, was deemed "a tour de force ranking with anything Joyce, Dickens, or Shakespeare wrote" by the thread's host.
